Metadata: In April 2012, the US Food and Drug Administration posted on its web site the Bad Bug Book - Foodborne Pathogenic Microorganisms and Natural Toxins, 2nd Edition. The Bad Bug Book is a handbook of basic current information about the major known agents that cause foodborne illness including: foodborne bacteria, viruses, parasites, prions, and naturally occurring toxins. In addition to updated scientific information, the book includes five new chapters (on Cronobacter, Enterococcus, Francisella tularensis, phytohaemagglutâ€‹inin, and venomous fish).
